data.text: At the #statsforum, panelist @ian_goldin discussed the challenges of national statistical offices to move beyond the standard framework for macroeconomic statistics to develop indicators of economic welfare.  https://t.co/5PmDIggSxX https://t.co/pTzZkJbIS5

Tune in now for a live conversation with @Lagarde and Jim Balsillie on data’s role in the digital economy and the economic implications of digitalization. https://t.co/5PmDIggSxX  #statsforum https://t.co/UsKB0NC7fK
Watch live: Jim Balsillie of @CIGIonline delivers keynote speech for the 6th #statsforum: Measuring Economic Welfare in the Digital Age: What and How? https://t.co/vet61daQP0 https://t.co/YkNXhlYMZp

Watch live: IMF Deputy Managing Director Tao Zhang is chairing a panel discussion on the need to move beyond the well-established measurement frameworks of GDP: “From theory to practice across diverse countries”.  #statsforum https://t.co/NYHU1cmTen https://t.co/fyMzdlbEn8

After 1990, inequality rose across most G-20 economies, and it remains high even in some emerging economies where it fell over that period #IMFBlog #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/zez6NeaIbX https://t.co/S3b0Yhj9Nv
Today, at the Sixth IMF Statistical Forum, Charles Hulten highlighted the Importance of Output-Saving Technical Change #statsforum https://t.co/Lp9XxBYzZf https://t.co/88sP1phehM

Is your job at risk of being automated? Men and women in the #UK and the #US face about the same amount of risk for job automation. In Japan and Israel, women’s jobs are more vulnerable to automation than men’s. #IMFGender #IMFBlog https://t.co/Llmg9EVSSs https://t.co/axfeVUIusE
How close has the G-20 come to its goal of “strong, sustainable, balanced, and inclusive growth”? See the G-20 report card in #IMFBlog #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/zez6NeaIbX https://t.co/eIotXBdyml

To move beyond middle-income status, the #ASEAN region will no longer be able to depend on the existing growth model of labor-intensive manufacturing for export. Further progress calls for bold reforms. Read more in our latest issue of F&D magazine https://t.co/GfbePJ2hyJ https://t.co/uTg64HUmzp
The global financial crisis and the resulting recession left long-lasting scars on future growth in more ways than one #IMFBlog https://t.co/zclcBMxiVG https://t.co/GDDpFOGW5W
How vulnerable is the $1.3 trillion leveraged-loan market to a sudden shift in investor risk appetite? Read #IMFBlog to find out why https://t.co/bIKx1nbBqz #debt #finance https://t.co/1Fqi2BKn6r
Silvana Tenreyro on the effects of trade escalation at this year's #ARCPolak Research Conference. Watch the sessions https://t.co/ErHBmvOn3y https://t.co/yJjNj7Kgo8

Will robots take women’s jobs? 26 million women’s jobs in 30 countries are at high risk of being displaced by technology within the next 20 years. #IMFGender #IMFBlog https://t.co/Llmg9EVSSs https://t.co/JvKXDzXHDo

The unemployment rate is at historic lows and wage growth has recovered, says IMF in its latest economic outlook of the #UK economy. However, productivity remains low. https://t.co/5CckbiNTSG https://t.co/s2LWkzxevr
Raghuram Rajan discussed cross border capital flows at this year's #ARCPolak Research Conference earlier this month. Watch all the sessions https://t.co/ErHBmvOn3y https://t.co/It8kRSnncv
The trend toward greater automation is especially challenging for women. Listen to the latest @imf_podcast #gendergap https://t.co/KpuGwV0dLl
Columbia University's Takatoshi Ito discussed the effects of spillovers at the #ARCPolak Research Conference earlier this month https://t.co/0G7QYhOTDe https://t.co/yIZLUKvM4z

“Well-designed public finance reforms can help policymakers reduce debt while preserving growth and protecting the most vulnerable,” said Jihad Azour, Director of the Middle East and Central Asia Department. #MENA https://t.co/SSgJPZ7YSu https://t.co/Z4bKaqOdUl

This year’s IMF Statistical Forum will bring together industry experts in Washington, DC on November 19-20 to discuss “Measuring Economic Welfare in the Digital Age: What and How?” Join our conversation via #statsforum https://t.co/dH42GlxHD1 https://t.co/Lg4dtM5P35
#IMFBlog’s #ChartOfTheWeek shows that in the decade before the crisis, the fertility rate rose in several advanced economies, only to decline afterward https://t.co/zclcBMxiVG https://t.co/n4Opf6uecD

26 million women’s jobs in 30 countries are at high risk of being displaced by technology w/in the next 20 yrs. Early investment in women in STEM fields, can help break down gender stereotypes and increase women in scientific fields. #IMFGender #IMFBlog https://t.co/Llmg9EVSSs https://t.co/27CPuVuy1B
On average, women face an 11 percent risk of losing their jobs due to automation, compared to 9 percent of their male counterparts. More in #IMFBlog https://t.co/Llmg9EVSSs https://t.co/MCHkmgJFqi

With an emphasis on equality of opportunity, Harvard economist Raj Chetty is reshaping the study of social mobility with big data. In the latest issue of F&D magazine, we profile Chetty and his groundbreaking work https://t.co/XVP84FpR8B https://t.co/nsG2ObVRrU

Professors Anne Case and Angus Deaton sit down with the IMF during the Fourth Annual Richard Goode lecture to talk about their intriguing topic of "Deaths of Despair." Read the full interview here: https://t.co/2Xh25LhtPO #IMF @Princeton https://t.co/udS2719fv4

Legal reforms highlighted by @OECDglobal are a key step to realizing the $1 trillion gains to GDP from narrowing the gender gap in labor force participation estimated by the IMF. Read more on #IMFGender here: https://t.co/hLPAVVevn9 #menaOECD  #Opportunity4MENA https://t.co/3IofBWu6AJ

Growth has moderated since the 2016 #Brexit referendum, moving the #UK from the top to near the bottom of the G7 growth tables https://t.co/5CckbiNTSG https://t.co/7wL1M1gYQP

An exit from the #EU without an agreement is the most significant risk to the outlook, says the IMF in its latest health check of the #UK economy. https://t.co/5CckbiNTSG https://t.co/iNb6C7loAF

Despite a weaker outlook for #Iran given sanctions, oil-exporting #MiddleEast and North Africa (#MENA) countries are projected to grow at 1.4% in 2018 and 2% in 2019. https://t.co/QWegz7IhdL https://t.co/As81qD5AOl

#ASEAN, one of the most vulnerable regions to climate change, is witnessing the world’s biggest jump in greenhouse gas emissions. A growing reliance on coal & oil, plus deforestation, are undermining efforts to embrace cleaner energy. More in F&D magazine https://t.co/HAhDxkt9v4 https://t.co/jTzii70NQO

.@Lagarde New IMF research shows that, with appropriate design, #CBDC could meet public policy goals, including financial inclusion, security and consumer protection; It could also provide what the private sector cannot: privacy in payments. @sgfintechfest https://t.co/Z6qoP09cMJ https://t.co/dIAfcoIg3g

.@Lagarde  I believe we should consider the possibility to issue digital currency. With appropriate design, there may be a role for the state to actually supply money to the digital economy. What can we do to better measure economic welfare? Is GDP the best way to measure the strength of an economy? Join us at the 6th IMF Statistical Forum in Washington, DC during November 19-20. We look forward to hearing your ideas.  #statsforum https://t.co/RWt34rtLGy https://t.co/KLhafvr9jf

Greater economic integration could boost growth in the #Caucasus and #Central Asia (#CCA) region. But that will only happen with further fiscal, monetary, structural, and financial sector reforms. https://t.co/Vr6PIDhIrh https://t.co/J12TARNJ0N

Усиление экономической интеграции может ускорить рост в регионе стран Кавказа и Центральной Азии (#CCA). Но это возможно только при проведении дальнейших реформ в налогово-бюджетной, денежно-кредитной и структурной сферах, а также в финансовом секторе. https://t.co/OjNqPEbYLx https://t.co/pIw6KbEukP
.@Lagarde: If in the next 10 years, we don’t invest in education, we will have massive numbers of people displaced by technologies. https://t.co/6ODQMOtlYx
See communique of the “1+6” meeting of international organizations held in Beijing on Nov 6 with the Chinese Premier Li. https://t.co/2V0WWuTRDT

At forecast growth rates, it would take #Caucasus and #CentralAsia (#CCA) countries two decades to reach living standards currently enjoyed in emerging Europe. What would help speed the convergence? https://t.co/Vr6PIDhIrh https://t.co/LEVTMKtf04

При прогнозных темпах роста странам Кавказа и Центральной Азии (#Caucasus, #CentralAsia) потребуется два десятилетия, чтобы достичь нынешнего уровня жизни в странах Европы с формирующимся рынком. Что может содействовать ускорению конвергенции? https://t.co/OjNqPEtzD5 https://t.co/XTFfs491Nm
#Caucasus and #CentralAsia (#CCA) countries face increasing global challenges, including rising trade tensions and tightening financial conditions. https://t.co/Vr6PIDhIrh https://t.co/77MD8TKfsZ

Страны Кавказа и Центральной Азии (#Caucasus, #CentralAsia) сталкиваются с растущими глобальными проблемами, в том числе с ростом напряженности в сфере торговли и ужесточением финансовых условий. https://t.co/OjNqPEbYLx https://t.co/HjOBHyREBz

Just published: After exceeding expectations in 2017, growth in #Caucasus and #CentralAsia countries is expected to stabilize. Read the Regional Economic Outlook on #CCA  https://t.co/Vr6PIDhIrh https://t.co/JuIQjMSIxZ

Только что опубликовано: Рост в странах Кавказа и Центральной Азии (#Caucasus, #CentralAsia), превысивший ожидания в 2017 году, как ожидается, стабилизируется. Читайте «Перспективы развития региональной экономики» на #CCA https://t.co/OjNqPEbYLx https://t.co/35oypCIWRm
